com.complexible.stardog.virtual.api.admin

Interface VirtualGraphAdminConnection

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AdminConnection, AutoCloseable

    public interface VirtualGraphAdminConnection
extends AdminConnection

    Connection to manage virtual graphs

    Since:
    3.1
    Version:
    5.0.2
    Author:
    Evren Sirin

      • Fields inherited from interface com.complexible.stardog.api.admin.AdminConnection

        as, backup, backup, builder, close, copy, createMemory, currentStatus, disk, drop, get, get, getPermissionManager, getQueryManager, getRoleManager, getStoredQueries, getUserManager, isOpen, list, memory, newDatabase, offline, offline, online, optimize, repair, restore, set, shutdown

    • Method Detail

      • getGraphs

        Collection<VirtualGraph> getGraphs()
        Returns all registered virtual graphs.

      • getGraph

        VirtualGraph getGraph(String theName)
        Returns the registered virtual graph with the given name.
        Throws:
        StardogException - if the graph does not exist or there is an error getting the graph

      • removeGraph

        boolean removeGraph(String theName)
        Removes the registered virtual graph with the given name. return true if the virtual graph exists and was removed, false if the virtual graph does not exist
        Throws:
        StardogException - if there is an error removing the graph

      • addGraph

        void addGraph(String theName,
              Properties theProps,
              Iterable<org.openrdf.model.Statement> theMappings)
        Registers a new virtual graph.
        Throws:
        StardogException - if there is already a registered virtual graph with the given name or if there is an error adding the graph

      • updateGraph

        void updateGraph(String theName,
                 Properties theProps,
                 Iterable<org.openrdf.model.Statement> theMappings)
        Registers a new virtual graph overwriting a previous version if it exists.
        Throws:
        StardogException - if there is an error updating the graph
